plants.name: Hamamelis virginiana
plants.description: A deciduous shrub or small tree known for its fragrant, ribbon-like yellow flowers that bloom in the cold of winter, often after leaf drop. It is native to eastern North America and is valued for its medicinal properties.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late fall to early winter (October to January)
plants.funFact: Witch Hazel's extract is commonly used in skincare products for its astringent and anti-inflammatory properties.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree producing large, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. It blooms profusely in the winter and early spring, often in gardens across temperate climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Winter to early spring (December to April)
plants.location: Native to eastern Asia; widely cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers were prized during the Victorian era as symbols of admiration and perfection.

plants.name: Eriosyce taltalensis
plants.description: A small, globular cactus native to the Atacama Desert in Chile, producing vibrant yellow flowers typically in the Southern Hemisphere summer months, which correspond to Northern Hemisphere winter.
plants.funFact: Despite extreme desert conditions, this cactus thrives and blooms during the Southern Hemisphere‚Äôs summer, which includes January.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant that blooms in the depths of winter, producing large white or pinkish flowers often around Christmas time, extending into January in temperate regions.
plants.funFact: Despite its name, the Christmas Rose is not a true rose but belongs to the buttercup family (Ranunculaceae).
